text: I'm looking for a hopeful path forward in my career, after 10 years of experience and feeling undervalued at my current job. I'm taking my recovery one meal at a time, just like I take one pedal stroke at a time when I'm cycling. Focusing on my set point and listening to my body has been a game changer. As someone who's single and has a father who was a cop, I've learned to be resilient and selfless. I'm excited to share my journey and support others in theirs.

As I sit at my computer for hours, I often find myself yearning for a deeper connection to my ancestral roots and a more rustic way of life. I believe that embracing traditional aesthetics can bring a sense of comfort and familiarity to our lives. Virtues such as simplicity, humility, and patience are essential in today's fast-paced world. Let's work together to promote these values online üåº. , I think it's time for us to slow down and appreciate the beauty in traditional lifestyles. #traditionalaesthetics ```json

Hey everyone, I'm Dakota_real66, and I'm, like, really passionate about sharing my weight gain journey and how it's helped me in my recovery from an eating disorder. I've noticed my period returning, and it's been a huge milestone for me. I want to use my experience to support others in their healing journeys, especially in the  community. I believe in the power of self-compassion and community, and I'm here to offer a listening ear and words of encouragement. I'm still learning, but I'm excited to connect with others who are going through similar experiences. ```json

i'm so done with people thinking they're better than me - i mean, i sell cars for a living and i know what it means to be a *giga chad* in the sales world... but no one gives me the respect i deserve. my wife, who's a hairdresser, always tells me to just calm down and have a coors, but it's hard when you're constantly dealing with entitled customers - and to make matters worse, i had a terrible game of basketball over the weekend üèÄ... just feeling really defeated and nihilistic, i guess - what's the point of it all, anyway?
